post.summary: Creates a new campagne with the calling user as dm.

200.description: The id of the newly created campagne

400.description: If the data provided is invalid

401.description: If you are not logged in

get.summary: Returns a list of campagnes this user is the dm of.

200.description: A list of all campagnes for this user as dm

400.description: If there was an error retrieving the campagnes

401.description: If you are not logged in

get.description: You must be the dm or a player in this campagne

parameters.name: campagneid
parameters.description: The id of the desired campagne

400.description: If there was an error retrieving the campagnes

401.description: If you are not logged in or you are not allowed to see this campagne

get.summary: Returns the minimal app version supported by this api.

post.summary:
This method generates a new encryptionChallenge and stores it in the db.
Use this method as first start point for a register operation.
post.description:
Additionally, it uses rsa encryption to comunicate: the client has to provide a public pem
certificate encrypted with the public pem of this server and receives the encryption challenge
RSA encrypted with the provided public cert.
This way, no man in the middle can pretend to be the server as each client has a copy of the public cert of the server.

requestBody.description: RSA encrpyted public pem cert of the client.

200.description: Returns the JWT for the user.

400.description: If the passed user input is invalid

post.summary: Creates a new user with "username and password" sign in.
post.description:
In order to signup the provided body must be RSA encrypted with
the public certificate of this server. The dto must be of type
RPGTableHelper.WebApi.Dtos.RegisterWithUsernamePasswordDto.

200.description: Returns the JWT for the user.

400.description: If the passed user input is invalid

409.description: If the desired username is already taken

post.summary: Creates a new user for an open sign OpenSignInProviderRegisterRequest.

requestBody.description: The register dto providing apikey and username

200.description: Returns the JWT for the user.

409.description: If the open OpenSignInProviderRegisterRequest does not have an email or the username is already taken

get.summary: Lets the user verify their email.
get.description: This link is send via email to the user after registration (and only if the user used username and password login).

parameters.name: signaturebase64
parameters.description: The server generated signature for the userid

200.description: Returns the JWT for the user.

get.summary: This method returns "Welcome" when the provided JWT is valid.

200.description: Returns the JWT for the user.

401.description: If the used jwt is not valid

post.summary: Returns the encryption challenge for a given username.
post.description:
Please note that the client has to provide an RSA public
key in order to receive the encrypted challenge dictionary.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: The username of the desired encryption challenge

requestBody.description: The public RSA key of the client

200.description: Returns the encrypted challenge dict for the user.

400.description: If request is not valid (user not found, key not valid, etc.)

post.summary: Performs the login with username and password.

200.description: Returns the jwt for the user

401.description: If username or password did not match

post.summary: Requests an reset password email for the user.

requestBody.description: The username and email for the user requesting the reset

400.description: If username or password did not match

post.summary: Completes the password reset requests by providing the reset code from the email.

requestBody.description: The username and email for the user requesting the reset

400.description: If username, email or reset code did not match

rpgConfiguration.description: This is the json serialized configuration of the rpg

EncryptedMessageWrapperDto.description: Represents a data transfer object for encapsulating encrypted messages.

accessToken.description: Gets or sets the Google Access Token.

identityToken.description: Gets or sets the Google Identity Token.

GoogleLoginDto.description: Data Transfer Object for Google login information.

username.description: Gets or sets the username of the user.

userSecretByEncryptionChallenge.description:
Gets or sets the hashed password of the user.
Either this has to be set or the ApiKey.
            
If this is set, the user is registering in with username + password, if not set,
the user is providing username and password after the sign in using a OIDC Provider
(like apple or google).

LoginWithUsernameAndPasswordDto.description: Data Transfer Object for user login information.

apiKey.description:
Gets or sets the api key of this user register request.
Either this has to be set or the UserSecret.

username.description: Gets or sets the username of the user.

email.description: Gets or sets the email address of the user.

username.description: Gets or sets the username of the user.

userSecret.description:
Gets or sets the hashed password of the user.
Either this has to be set or the ApiKey.
            
If this is set, the user is registering in with username + password, if not set,
the user is providing username and password after the sign in using a OIDC Provider
(like apple or google).

email.description: Gets or sets the email address of the user requesting a password reset.

newHashedPassword.description: Gets or sets the user requested updated password of the user.

resetCode.description: Gets or sets the users reset code for the reset password operation.

username.description: Gets or sets the username of the user requesting a password reset.

email.description: Gets or sets the email address of the user requesting a password reset.

username.description: Gets or sets the username of the user requesting a password reset.

ResetPasswordRequestDto.description: Data Transfer Object for password reset requests.

Bearer.description:
JWT Authorization header using the Bearer scheme. 

 Enter 'Bearer' [space] and then your token in the text input below.

Example: "Bearer 1safsfsdfdfd"
Bearer.name: Authorization
